pageContext.claim: “You know somebody said, ‘Oh, this speech you made, sir, the State of the Union speech, was incredible.’ Listen. They said that was so great. … I got great reviews even from some of the really bad ones out there. Of course, by the following morning, they had to change because the head people called them. ‘What are you doing?’ A lot of it's not the people on television, you know? A lot of it's their bosses.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump claims with no evidence that media personalities gave him high marks for his State of the Union speech in 2019 and then reversed course the next morning on orders from high-ranking executives.
